il_representations.scripts package¶

Subpackages¶

  • il_representations.scripts.data package
    • Module contents

Submodules¶

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs module¶

Recursively collate repL and IL training configs from some directory. Deduplicate the configs (using equivalence modulo seed), group the configs by exp_ident and benchmark/task name, and print out to console.

class il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.IndentedStream(indent: int, *, inner_stream: TextIO = <_io.TextIOWrapper name='<stdout>' mode='w' encoding='UTF-8'>)¶

Bases: IO[str]

Text mode pseudo-file that indents text written to it.

close()¶

Flush and close the IO object.

This method has no effect if the file is already closed.

flush()¶

Flush write buffers, if applicable.

This is not implemented for read-only and non-blocking streams.

write(data: str) → int¶

Write string to stream. Returns the number of characters written (which is always equal to the length of the string).

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.collect_configs(subdir_path_iter: Iterator[Tuple[str, str]]) → List[dict]¶
il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.common_prefix_len(strs: List[str]) → int¶

Find length of common prefix in a list of strings.

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.config_generator(search_dir: str, *, config_name: str = 'config.json') → Iterator[str]¶

Recursively walk a directory looking for config.json files.

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.do_final_printing(hash_dict: dict)¶

Print out one of the subdicts returned as values by collect_configs().

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.filter_configs(config_generator: Iterator[str], *, allowed_subdirs: Iterable[str] = ('repl', 'il_train')) → Iterator[Tuple[str, str]]¶

Filter config.json paths returned by some config generator to include only those paths whose grandparent directory is allowed_subdirs.

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.format_exp_ident(config_dict: dict, *, key: str = 'exp_ident') → str¶
il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.format_task_and_benchmark(config_dict: dict) → str¶
il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.hash_config(config_dict: dict, *, forbidden=('seed', 'encoder_path')) → str¶

Hash config dict, modulo seed, encoder path, etc.

il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.load_config(config_path: str) → dict¶
il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.main(args)¶
il_representations.scripts.collate_configs.strip_common_prefix(strs: List[str]) → Tuple[str, List[str]]¶

il_representations.scripts.grab_some_stuff_and_pickle_it module¶

Grabs some random frames from a webdataset and pickles them. Also writes out some metadata like trajectory number (in the webdataset) and also frame number.

il_representations.scripts.grab_some_stuff_and_pickle_it.frame_iter(dataset: webdataset.Dataset) → Iterable[dict]¶

Iterate over observations, along with

il_representations.scripts.grab_some_stuff_and_pickle_it.run(n_frames: int, out_path: str, dataset_config: dict, oversample: int, seed: int) → None¶
il_representations.scripts.grab_some_stuff_and_pickle_it.sample_rand_frames(dataset: webdataset.Dataset, n_frames: int, oversample: int) → Iterable[dict]¶

Sample n_frames randomly chosen frames from the first (oversample * n_frames) frames in the dataset.

il_representations.scripts.grab_some_stuff_and_pickle_it.trajectory_iter(dataset: webdataset.Dataset) → Iterable[List[dict]]¶

Yields one trajectory at a time from a webdataset.

Run an IL algorithm in some selected domain.

il_representations.scripts.interpret module¶

class il_representations.scripts.interpret.InterpAlgos¶

Bases: object

get(name)¶
register(f)¶
class il_representations.scripts.interpret.Network(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: torch.nn.torch.nn.Module._name

forward(obs)¶
il_representations.scripts.interpret.attribute_image_features(network, algorithm, image, label, **kwargs)¶
il_representations.scripts.interpret.choose_layer(network, module_name, layer_idx)¶

network - The network to be interpreted. module_name - The network module being interpreted. It should be either “encoder” or “decoder”. layer_idx - The index of the layer to be studied. It belongs to the module specified by module_name.

il_representations.scripts.interpret.figure_2_tensor(fig)¶

Captum’s visualize_image_attr method returns matplotlib.pyplot.figure object. To process and plot figures, we need to convert them to torch tensors first.

il_representations.scripts.interpret.plot_linear_layer_attributions(lc_attr_test, layer_weight, save_name, save_dir, show_imgs=True)¶

il_representations.scripts.joint_training_cluster module¶

Thin wrapper to run joint_training.py on a Ray server.

exception il_representations.scripts.joint_training_cluster.ArgumentParseFailed¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when Sacred fails to parse arguments.

il_representations.scripts.joint_training_cluster.hacky_run_commandline(exp, argv)¶

Version of Experiment.run_commandline that DOESN’T DO SYS.EXIT(1) WHEN IT FAILS TO PARSE ARGS grrrrr.

il_representations.scripts.joint_training_cluster.main(args, sacred_args)¶

Main entry point on the Ray client. Essentially just spins up a Ray task & then exits once it terminates.

il_representations.scripts.joint_training_cluster.run_joint_training_remote(extra_args)¶

This function executes the experiment. It is intended to be wrapped with ray.remote and run as a Ray task.

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset module¶

Loads a webdataset and renders it into images, while printing out some debugging info. Useful for verifying that the file contains what you think it contains!

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.concat_traj(traj: List[Dict[str, Any]]) → Dict[str, numpy.ndarray]¶

Combine the per-step dictionaries that make up a trajectory into a single dictionary that maps keys to concatenated values.

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.get_n_chans() → int¶
il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.run(n_traj: int, frames_per_traj: int, out_dir: str, dataset_config: dict, keep_only_latest: bool, border_size: int, seed: int) → None¶
il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.sample_points(traj_len: int, n_points: Optional[int] = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Collect n_points indices into array, spaced ~evenly (or just return all points, if n_points is None).

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.save_obs_as_film(obs: numpy.ndarray, dest: str, keep_only_latest: bool, border_size: int, frames_per_traj: int) → None¶

Save a list of observations in N*(C*F)*H*W format into a file, after converting to a ‘film strip’ (appropriate for representing, e.g., a continuous trajectory).

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.simplify_stacks(obs_vec: numpy.ndarray, keep_only_latest: bool) → numpy.ndarray¶
il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.to_film_strip(images: numpy.ndarray, border_size: int = 1) → numpy.ndarray¶

Convert an N*C*H*W array of image frames into a horizontal ‘film strip’ with a black border of border_size separating the frames (as will as a border on the outsides).

il_representations.scripts.render_dataset.trajectory_iter(dataset)¶

Yields one trajectory at a time from a webdataset.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net module¶

Trace & save a network for a MAGICAL environment. Capable of automatically figuring out where the encoder is.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.auto_save_name(module_path: str) → str¶

Use config.json files to automatically come up with a name for the given encoder.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.fetch_encoder(net: torch.nn.modules.module.Module) → torch.nn.modules.module.Module¶
il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.get_config_path(module_path: str) → Optional[str]¶

Keep walking up the tree until we find a config.json.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.load_eval_net(net_path: str) → torch.nn.modules.module.Module¶

Load a network on disk, making sure it ends up on the CPU & in eval mode.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.main(args: argparse.Namespace) → None¶
il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.pre_order_children(net: torch.nn.modules.module.Module) → Iterator[Tuple[str, torch.nn.modules.module.Module]]¶

Traverse module tree in pre-order.

il_representations.scripts.save_traced_net.trace_encoder(encoder: torch.nn.modules.module.Module) → torch.nn.modules.module.Module¶

Generate a random example of the appropriate size & use it to trace the given network.
